level.text: An independent living program shall develop and follow a written plan for providing recreational activities adequate to meet each resident’s needs, including:

Sufficient supervised, organized or structured individual and group recreational programs, both indoors and outdoors, appropriate to the resident’s age, interests, and needs, and consistent with the resident’s ITILP;
Free time for residents to pursue their individual interests, with protective supervision as required, unless otherwise provided in the resident’s ITILP;
The maximum use of available community recreational resources, where appropriate;
Reasonable access to sufficient recreational supplies, equipment and activities appropriate to the resident’s age, interests, and needs; and
Usable leisure-time materials, including but not limited to books, games, and toys that are appropriate to the resident’s sex and stage of development, and transportation to local libraries.
An independent living program shall provide at least one (1) recreational activity per calendar quarter for the participation of all residents.
